description: This script demonstrates how to use the bear movement detection system with mock data. It sets up mock detection data, processes frames to analyze bear movement, and saves results to a temporary database.

classes.name: BoundingBox
classes.description: Represents a bounding box for detected objects, including label, confidence, and coordinates.

classes.name: FrameDetection
classes.description: Encapsulates detection data for a single video frame, including timestamp, detected bears, static objects, frame number, and video timestamp.

classes.name: MovementAnalyzer
classes.description: Analyzes frame data to determine the movement state of the bear (resting or moving) based on detection position changes and thresholds.

classes.name: DatabaseManager
classes.description: Handles database interactions for saving detection and movement analysis results.

classes.name: Config
classes.description: Configuration class containing static settings such as database URL, labels, thresholds, and model paths.

methods.name: create_mock_frame_data()
methods.description: Creates a sequence of mock frame detections simulating bear movement with specified positions and static objects.

methods.name: demonstrate_movement_detection()
methods.description: Runs a demonstration of the movement detection process using the mock data, processing frames, analyzing movement, and saving results.

methods.name: show_configuration()
methods.description: Displays current configuration settings from the Config class.

methods.name: main()
methods.description: Main entry point of the script that runs configuration display and the demonstration.
